text: it's summertime and that means fresh
farmers market corn corn is wonderful
but there's one conundrum and that is
that pesky silk that sticks onto the cob
but I have a trick that makes this whole
process faster so just remove the husk
of the corn and if you take a stiff
bristled brush any vegetable brush will
work even one of these a clean
toothbrush and all you do is brush the
corn and all of the silk comes off you
don't have to worry you don't have to
wash it you don't have to rub it it's
just as simple as that
so fast so easy and now for the simplest
preparation a pot of boiling water drop
the ears in about five minutes
in simmering water and you'll have the
best corn of the season the corn is nice
and tender I like to serve it with just
a little bit of unsalted butter and then
a little bit of flaky sea salt I love
the crunch that you get from it but if
you have kosher salt that's fine too
and there you have it sweet summer silk
free corn all you need is a stiff
bristled brush and you're ready for the
summer
hey guys thanks for watching do you have
a kitchen conundrum that you need solved
well if you do write in the comment
section below and as always click
